speaker: JANITOR 2
line: Okay, okay.

speaker: JANITOR 1
line: nan

speaker: JANITOR 2
line: Okay.

speaker: JANITOR 1
line: Santa maria san locos.

speaker: WORKER 1
line: What the hell is that?

speaker: WORKER 2
line: Hey! Get out of the way!

speaker: WORKER 3
line: He's hurt bad, man!

speaker: WORKER 2
line: Hurry up! Get an ambulance!

speaker: BREWER
line: This is Wesley Brewer out on Route 7. Looks like down.

speaker: DISPATCHER
line: 10-4, Wesley.

speaker: BREWER
line: Mother of God!

speaker: WOMAN
line: She was just lying there when we found her, officer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you saw nothing when the window broke? No one outside?

speaker: JANITOR 1
line: No.

speaker: JANITOR 2
line: Nothing.

speaker: JANITOR 1
line: We heard a noise like thunder. Then glass everywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did the janitors say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They claim they didn't see anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not surprising. The security monitors don't have a recording of anything either. Just a giant implosion of glass like some kind of giant shock wave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the janitors describe sounds more like a sonic boom.

speaker: MULDER
line: No sonic boom did this. The construction worker who was killed had his spine crushed like a string of seashells, a circular abrasion on his torso in roughly the shape of an elephant's foot. Other workers at the site said they felt the ground shake followed by a faint whiff of animal odor in the wind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if you're still suggesting that the elephant did this, it just defies logic. Somebody would have seen it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if somebody would have seen it, Scully, we wouldn't be here. Another vehicle would have left evidence of a collision - distress to the metal, or paint. I can see signs of neither of those things. I'd be willing to admit the possibility of a tornado but it's not really tornado season. I'd even be willing to entertain the notion of a black hole passing over the area...... or some cosmic anomaly, but it's not really black hole season, either. If I was a betting man I'd say that it was, uh,...

speaker: SCULLY
line: An invisible elephant?

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw David Copperfield make the Statue of Liberty disappear once.

speaker: MEECHAM
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: MEECHAM
line: Ed Meecham, Fairfield Zoo. Sorry for the holdup. We had trouble transporting Ganesha's body this morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Agent Scully.

speaker: MEECHAM
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have they determined what he died of?

speaker: MEECHAM
line: She. Ganesha was a 12-year-old Indian female. Near as I can figure, she ran herself into exhaustion.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did she escape?

speaker: MEECHAM
line: Well now, there's a puzzle. When I got the call this morning, I expected to find her cage open or something but it was locked tight just like I left it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea how she could have escaped a locked cage?

speaker: MEECHAM
line: No, sir. No signs of tampering.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've read about something called the elephant rebellion in zoos across the country - a high incidence of elephants turning on their keepers, destroying their pens. Was Ganesha ever a problem like that?

speaker: MEECHAM
line: Elephants are very big, very willful animals.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you're saying there were problems?

speaker: MEECHAM
line: Well, the person you're gonna want to talk to about that is Willa Ambrose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ambrose?

speaker: MEECHAM
line: She's a naturalist. She was hired by the Board of Supervisors last year to oversee things. Well, now she's supposed to be the reigning authority.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, let me ask you something. In your opinion, the damage here on the street - could this have been caused by an escaped elephant?

speaker: MEECHAM
line: In my honest opinion?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: MEECHAM
line: Sure. Will you excuse me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What're you looking for, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: A local paper. I want to see if David Copperfield's in town.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me. We're looking for Willa Ambrose.

speaker: WORKER
line: There.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: WORKER
line: Sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Miss Ambrose?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Agent Dana Scully. This is Agent Mulder. We're with the FBI.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: How can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, a federal employee was fatally injured last night, and there seems to be a case developing around the elephant that escaped from your zoo.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It was my understanding that the eyewitnesses to the accident said that they didn't know how the man was killed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually, what we're trying to determine is how Ganesha escaped.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Well, what did Ed tell you?

speaker: MULDER
line: He said he found the cage locked, the same way he left it.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: What more can I say?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't want to belabor this, but a man was found trampled to death. An animal from your zoo was found 43 miles from here. No one's looking to place any blame, we're just trying to understand the facts that led up to this incident.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: This is where Ganesha was held when she wasn't in her habitat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who has keys to this lock?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Only myself and Mr. Meecham. Otherwise, this is a restricted area. Elephants aren't particularly good jumpers if that's what you're thinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I was just wondering why such a small pen for such a large animal.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: The zoo was built in the 1940s. The pens and habitats are all too confining. I was brought on to expand and create more humane environments. Unfortunately, these things take time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Those, uh, chains on the ground there?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Those are tie-downs. They're meant to restrict the animal's movement. I disallowed their use when I came to work here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Disallowed their use by whom?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It was Ed Meecham's practice. It reflected an old, nonprogressive zoo policy.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's your relationship with Ed Meecham?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I'm his boss and I'm a woman, and Ed doesn't like that much.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would he be vindictive enough to let Ganesha go as an act of sabotage?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Well, if he did that would be foolish. The facility is running at a deficit and in danger of losing its funding.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you spoken about the incident with Ed?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: No. I think Ed's got enough dealing with the W.A.O.

speaker: SCULLY
line: W.A.O?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the Wild Again Organization - they're a radical group that believes any captive animal is a crime against nature.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Believe me they're gonna have a field day with this one. Excuse me.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: The W.A.O. believes only tragedy results from keeping animals in captivity. In the wild, an elephant like that would roam an area 20 square miles, minimum. Ganesha weighed in excess of 5000 pounds, and she was being held in a 50 by 50 foot cage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you consider that inhumane treatment?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: It's like you or I living in a pickle barrel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: According to FBI files, you've been arrested over a dozen times for activities involving the kidnapping of circus and zoo animals.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: The W.A.O. sees it as liberation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmmm. Were you involved in the liberation of Ganesha?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: That would make me an accessory to murder, wouldn't it? Endangering these animals is against everything we believe. These are incredibly spiritual creatures. Their rituals and behavior are linked to a past no man ever witnessed. Did you know they actually bury their dead? They can visit an elephant graveyard centuries old and know instinctively where the bones of their ancient ancestors lie.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you think Ganesha was running from?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: You want to see what she was running from? I'll show you.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: This is how Ed Meecham treats these majestic animals.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is still going on?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Ed Meecham's a barbarian. He's been torturing animals at the Fairfield Zoo for years. We figure he's still at it. Eventually we're gonna get some proof. We're here to put pressure on the zoo. We're keeping track of what goes on there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Even though Willa Ambrose claims that she's put a stop to most of his old practices?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Whatever Willa Ambrose's intentions, she's too preoccupied to really know how Meecham operates.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Preoccupied with what?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: A lawsuit she's fighting against the Malawi government over a lowland gorilla named Sophie. Willa rescued her from a north African customs house ten years ago. Raised her like a child. Now the Malawi government wants her back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Will they win?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: This is a perfect example of man's imperialism over the animal kingdom - this craven impulse to turn animals into objects for our own selfish pleasure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought you said she rescued this gorilla.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Yeah, rescued her so she could spend a life behind bars. Her obligation should have been to return the gorilla to the wild. All animals should run free.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even if that means trampling a man to death?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Maybe he should have gotten out of the way.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure he would have if he'd seen it coming. Thanks for your time, sir, and we'll get back to you soon.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's all happening at the zoo, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we found our suspects.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think they busted out the elephant?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you heard the man - "all animals should run free."

speaker: MULDER
line: What about all the eyewitness accounts, the security tapes from the video camera, the fact no one saw an elephant until it was miles away from the zoo?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the lights they were using at the construction site were mercury vapor, 10,000 candlepower. They can restrict a man's ability to adjust his vision to the dark. And their security cameras are poor quality. A gray elephant may not have registered an image on tape in the dim light in front of the building.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, I'm not buying it, Scully. I think these guys are all talk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These guys are dedicated to exactly this kind of activity, unabashedly. Did you check out the night vision camera they had lying on the shelf?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It wouldn't surprise me if they tried to capitalize on their success.

speaker: MULDER
line: By doing what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: By liberating another animal. Willa Ambrose said that the zoo was in trouble financially. A loss of another big exhibit could shut them down entirely.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right. You keep an eye on the W.A.O.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: Talk to the animals.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Beam me up, Scotty.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did anybody ever tell you the camera loves you, Frohike?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah, the arresting officers at the "Free James Brown" rally.

speaker: BYERS
line: So what's this costing the taxpayers, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, about 150 bucks an hour.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Ouch. Almost as much as Bill Clinton's haircuts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's Langley?

speaker: BYERS
line: He has a philosophical issue with having his image bounced off a satellite.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What are you doing in Idaho?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm in the town of Fairfield. What do you know about it?

speaker: BYERS
line: They got a little zoo there. Lots of strange lore - animals escaping, disappearing without a trace.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea why?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You're not far from the Mountain Home Air Base. Major UFO hot spot.

speaker: BYERS
line: Weird fact, Mulder. No animal at Fairfield Zoo has ever brought a pregnancy to term.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Not a cub or a chick.

speaker: BYERS
line: The woman who runs the zoo has a gorilla that knows sign language - supposedly with a vocabulary of 1,000 words.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: If that's the lovely Agent Scully, let her know I've been working out. I'm buff.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I was right. I just followed the kid from the W.A.O. to the zoo. He's just about to make it over the fence.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I'll be right there, Scully.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: What the hell are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a member of the W.A.O. on the premises.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: Come with me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It's okay, Sophie. Calm down.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You have no idea what he was doing at the zoo?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: If you're asking me if I have any idea of his intentions, the answer is simple. Not the slightest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if I said I saw this camera sitting up there on the shelf yesterday?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Guess I never noticed it before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A tiger is missing, and a member of your organization is dead. For such a principled man, you show an amazing lack of emotion.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: If the tiger killed this person, then it was a natural act.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if I find evidence that he was releasing those animals under your orders, I'll make sure you spend the rest of your life behind bars.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, that guy really pisses me off.

speaker: MULDER
line: You okay, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: You calmed down?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have they found the tiger yet?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but I looked at the cassette from the kid's recorder. He wasn't killed by the tiger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless it's trick photography, that kid was killed by some kind of phantom attacker.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You saw his body, Mulder. That kid was mauled to death. He had deep claw marks on his chest and on his back.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't explain it either, but I know someone who might be able to.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me? Miss Ambrose? May we have a word with you?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I don't know anything more than I've already told the police. I have nothing to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is this where you keep Sophie?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Sophie is ill.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think we could meet her? We're not here to try to take her away from you.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: About six weeks ago I had to take Sophie out of her public habitat. She'd become so withdrawn and depressed, she'd curl into a ball in the corner of her cage and just shiver.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you ask her why?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: All the time.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd she say?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: "Light afraid." Literally, she's afraid of the light.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She speaks to you?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Over 600 words using American sign language. She understands over a thousand. I'll show you her vocabulary list.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this who you wanted to speak to, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's basic investigative procedure, Agent Scully - interview all possible witnesses.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Gorillas are highly sensitive creatures, and Sophie's use of language skills makes her even more so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would she be afraid of the light?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Well, you've obviously heard about the trouble with the Malawi government. There's a chance that Sophie could be taken away from me, and I think that she knows that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are these Sophie's?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you think they mean?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Well, until recently Sophie desperately wanted a baby. The brown object in the center is her expression of that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you tried to mate her?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: We were looking for a partner but under these stressful conditions I didn't want to put her through it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have a veterinary facility here?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, this may seem like a rather strange request but it might help explain what's been going on here. I'm gonna need your help on this, too, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I hope you know what you're getting us into, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm pretty sure of what we're gonna find.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This isn't exactly in my job description.

speaker: MULDER
line: And the next thing you know, they'll be doing it on MTV Sports.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Okay. The elephant's cavity is clear. I'm ready for you.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: The knife's right down there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been told there's never been a successful pregnancy at the Fairfield Zoo.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Sounds like you've been talking to Kyle Lang.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, is it true?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yes. But I don't think for the reasons Kyle claims - not because Ed Meecham has done anything to these animals.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why then?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Because bringing a pregnancy to term in captivity is always difficult.

speaker: MULDER
line: But a perfect failure rate?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I know. It's one of the things I was determined to change when I came to the zoo.

speaker: MULDER
line: Was an attempt ever made to mate Ganesha?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: No. Mating an elephant out of the wild is rarely successful. There have only been six elephants born in captivity over the last ten years.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Here's the uterine tissue, but I'm still not clear on what you expect to find.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're right, Mulder. The signs in the uterus and ovaries are unmistakable.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: So what did you find?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This animal had been pregnant.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's evidence of hyperplasia and the corpus luteum is ruptured.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: That's not possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Neither is an invisible elephant.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: What is going on here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever it is it's been going on for some time, and I think you'll find evidence of the same thing when your tiger returns.

speaker: WORKER 1
line: I still can't believe you bet on the Chargers.

speaker: WORKER 2
line: You hear that?

speaker: WORKER 1
line: Hear what?

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: Where's the tiger?

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: Somewhere inside the construction site. He's got two men trapped in there.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Put the gun away, Ed.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: You want to be responsible for another death, Miss Ambrose?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I think we can capture this cat without any harm to anyone.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: This is no time for wishful thinking.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I'm ordering you, Ed.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: Yes, ma'am. Lead the way.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How'd the tiger get all the way across town without being spotted?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but we better find it before Meecham does.

speaker: WORKER 1
line: Hey! Shhh! It was just here.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: It's all right, Willa. They don't all talk and draw pictures.

speaker: BOARD MEMBER
line: This last incident has left the Board with no choice but to withdraw all funding.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Well, if that's your decision, there's nothing else I can say.

speaker: BOARD MEMBER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I'm out of a job. They've cut off all funding. The animals are being shipped out to other zoos starting Monday.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It could not have happened at a worse time.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean for Sophie?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: What I had going for me was my position here. Having a place for her. Have the results come in on the tiger?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully just finished the test. The tiger had been pregnant too.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It's impossible. Theres no chance those animals could get pregnant. No way.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if they've been artificially inseminated?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: That's an extremely fine and complex process. I would have known.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless it was done somewhere else.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you know about alien abduction?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: You're... you're... you're kidding me. You think these animals were taken aboard some space ship?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know where they're being taken but there's obviously some problem getting them back. Due to what is probably an astrological variation, a trouble with the time-space continuum - these animals that are being taken from locked cages are being returned roughly two miles westsouthwest of the zoo.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Aliens impregnating zoo animals?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, and harvesting the embryos.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe their own Noah's ark? To preserve the DNA of these animals that we're depleting to extinction. Whatever it is, that's probably the reason why you've never had a successful birth at this facility.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I think that's the most ridiculous thing I've heard.

speaker: MULDER
line: I understand that you might think it's ridiculous. Maybe you should ask Sophie.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: You think this is what she's so afraid of?

speaker: MULDER
line: I believe she's pregnant, and she's afraid of them coming for her baby.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Sophie, come here. I want to ask you a question. It's okay, Sophie. Come here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd she say?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: She says, "man, woman - hurt." She thinks you or your partner are going to hurt her or me. Sophie...... man, woman are here to help you. They want to know about Sophie's baby.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I ask her a question?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Will you ask her if she wants to leave here?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Sophie - do you want to leave here?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: She says "light afraid." Sophie, what are you afraid of? Tell me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did she say?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: She said, "baby go flying light."

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just finished up in the infirmary. A sheriff's deputy came looking to serve you papers. I think it's about Sophie.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: What am I going to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever you do, you can't leave Sophie here. Not if you want to protect her.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I have nowhere else to take her.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Excuse me. Willa Ambrose?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yes.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: I'm serving you with a court order to release a gorilla named Sophie into protective custody.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I've come to ask for your help, Kyle.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Help with what?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Sophie. They've taken her into protective custody.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Let her go, Willa.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: They're putting her in an iron cage as we speak - without bars, without windows. It'll kill her.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Sophie's been behind bars her entire life. Let her go home, Willa. She'll have the freedom she deserves.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Freedom to what - be killed by poachers and have her hands cut off as souvenirs?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: They've promised she'll be in a preserve.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: She's mine, Kyle! I won't let her go! Please, come on. We can find a place for her here - a private reserve. You know people.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: That's against everything I stand for.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: She's pregnant.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: What?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Sophie's pregnant.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: I don't believe you, Willa.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It's true.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Well what if she was? Is the baby gonna live out its life behind bars, too? Look, Willa, she doesn't belong to you. She's not your child. She belongs with other gorillas, not selling tickets for a zoo.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: You won't help me?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You want to see something interesting?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you get this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was looking for a pen to finish my report in Willa's office, and it was in her drawer.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a small world, after all.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It's okay, Sophie. It's okay, honey. Sophie, Sophie, Sophie - don't worry. I'm with you.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I love you too.

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Willa?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Willa? Are you there?

speaker: KYLE LANG
line: Willa? Where are you? Willa?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I told you, it happened exactly the way it did with the tiger. I heard the animals going crazy. I got out of bed to check on Sophie and she was gone. That's when I found Kyle.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any idea what he would have been doing at the zoo?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have a witness who says that you visited Kyle's office yesterday. Is that true?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what purpose?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Basically, to tell him he'd won. That the zoo was being shut down, that Sophie was being taken into protective custody.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you ask him to help you take Sophie to prevent her from being taken from you?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: No. That would be against everything Kyle believed in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But he helped you to rescue her originally, isn't that correct? He had a connection to you and to this animal that went back several years.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Whatever connection he and I had was over long ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you asked him anyway... to help you.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then what was he doing here last night, and why did he give you this note?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: I don't know. I told you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he make a habit of visiting the zoo?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: If he did, it was probably late at night after he jumped over the fence like a good W.A.O. soldier. Anyway, why don't you ask Agent Mulder what he thinks happened? He seems to have a novel theory. Maybe it was alien abduction.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, can I talk to you for a second?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think she's telling the truth?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Kyle Lang's death and the disappearance of the animal match the previous incidents.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you've been pushing this alien abduction angle.

speaker: MULDER
line: I still am, but in this case, Willa's reactions are all wrong.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean to losing Sophie?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think she knows where Sophie is, and Kyle Lang died because he knows what she's capable of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think she killed him?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think she'd do anything to protect that animal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even wait atop a stack of crates for a former lover to walk underneath?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think an examination of the body will give us a lot clearer picture of what happened last night. You do that, and I'll check out the warehouse.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks like you're in a hurry.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Well, there isn't much to hang around for, is there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm afraid there is. I found evidence that Kyle died a wrongful death. He was hit with a cattle prod. There's gonna be an investigation so I have to read you your rights.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: It was an accident. Kyle surprised Ed. He wasn't supposed to be there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed Meecham took Sophie?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Yes. There was no one else to turn to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is she, Willa?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Ed has her. She's in some building on the road to Boise.

speaker: MULDER
line: Put it down, Ed. There's been enough violence, don't you think?

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: I didn't kill Kyle Lang.

speaker: MULDER
line: Put down the gun and we'll talk about it.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: I was only doing what she paid me to do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is the animal, Ed?

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: Down the hall.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. You show me where - we're gonna go there together. Come on.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's she doing?

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: She's throwing herself against the door. She's gone crazy.

speaker: MULDER
line: She's scared.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: Yeah? Well, she's gonna kill herself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, Ed. Well, you're going to have to save her. Take your tranquilizer gun. I'll be right behind you.

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: I've only got one dart in this thing, so you got to get her out in the light.

speaker: MULDER
line: You see her?

speaker: ED MEECHAM
line: I think she's over in that corner over there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Meecham!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not gonna hurt you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry. Lie still.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's Sophie?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lie down. Can we get a paramedic in here?

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: Yes, ma'am.

speaker: MULDER
line: Meecham.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed Meecham's been arrested. We picked him up on the way to Boise. That's how we found you here.

speaker: MULDER
line: They took Sophie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who did?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's Willa?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's outside. She's going in to make a statement about Kyle Lang.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got to talk to her.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Where is she?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's gone.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: What did he do to her?

speaker: MULDER
line: It wasn't Ed. She tried to tell me something.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that?

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: That doesn't make any sense.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does it mean? "Man save man."

speaker: DISPATCHER'S VOICE
line: We've just received a report of a large animal spotted down off the interstate just west of the service road off...

speaker: MULDER
line: That's her.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: She's heading back towards the zoo.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Where is she?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Over there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened here?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Animal got hit by a car. Ran off in the field.

speaker: WILLA AMBROSE
line: Oh, no. Oh, no, no. Sophie! Sophie! Oh, no, no.

speaker: MULDER
line: Willa Ambrose and Ed Meecham have been charged with manslaughter for the death of Kyle Lang. And though the courts will rule on this matter, and justice will be no doubt be served, the pall of a greater tragedy remains. The motives of the silent visitors who set these events in motion remain unclear. Could this be a judgement on a global rate of extinction that has risen to 1000 times its natural rate in this century? An act of alien conservation of animals we are driving hard toward oblivion? And if so, might it follow that our own fate and existence could finally be dependent upon the conservatorship of an extraterrestrial race? Or in the simple words of a creature whose own future is uncertain, will "man save man?"
